jobs.title: Community Support
jobs.description:
Purpose
Manage all activities related to EasyPeasy community, marketing and team support – encompassing our, social media, content creation, blog, events and support platform

Reporting to
Steph Coleman – Community Manager

Responsibilities

Create support articles, community blogs to share via our website, newsletter and beyond. 

You will regularly create engaging text, image and video content for our social media channels.

Implement social media and communication campaigns to align with our community building strategies.

Help support the business team with inbound content activities

Identify key events that align with business goals and build brand awareness
Explore ways to add value to our community and product evolution.

Foster a culture of community support across our entire business – from playing the role of internal evangelist to educating other teams on best practice and beyond.

Build and maintain a community support experience that is helpful, reassuring, and enlightening, adding value to our platform and brand.

Own technical support, coordinating other members of the team, ensuring tickets are treated in a consistent tone of voice and quality worthy of a user-driven brand.

Achieve a high level of satisfaction (e.g. positive support survey score/sentiment) and productivity (e.g. average support response times).

Prepare bug reports that arise through our community.

Generate weekly/monthly support activity reports, sharing insights & recommendations with other teams to improve the product experience.

Support the EP team – schedule meetings and appointments; assist in the on-boarding process for new hires; address office management issues (e.g. room bookings, hardware and travel arrangements)

What we’re looking for

Classroom/teaching/childcare experience highly advantageous

Amazing written English communication skills.

Passion for content creation - you might have your own blog, curated Instagram account or have experience running previous business related social media channels

A people person with a drive to build and nurture teacher communities

Knowledge of online marketing and marketing channels.

Life at EasyPeasy
We have fantastic offices in London and Madrid.
Our salaries and benefits are competitive.
You’ll get a computer and software that makes your work productive and enjoyable.
We’re a flexible employer (but we prefer to hang out together).
We work a 37.5 hour week.
We like to play :)

jobs.title: React Native Developer (Madrid Based)
jobs.description:
Join us to create our new iOS and Android applications. You will be part of the definition and implementation of this challenging project from the ground up. You will work with our CTO to define software requirements and take the lead on operational and technical projects.

You should be able to work independently with little supervision, have excellent organisation and problem-solving skills. You will have hands-on experience in software development and agile methodologies.

Your goal will be to develop high-quality software that is aligned to user needs and business goals.

Requirements

Proven experience developing and deploying iOS/Android apps with React Native (personal apps are also a plus)
A strong understanding of technologies used in our tech stack:
React Native with Redux
API integration
Test-driven development
Deployment automation
Some native development is ideal
Analytical mind with problem-solving aptitude
Ability to work independently
Excellent organisational and leadership skills
BSc/BA in Computer Science, a related degree or proven experience
Strong written and spoken English

Responsibilities

Develop high-quality software design and architecture
Identify, prioritise and execute tasks in the software development life cycle
Develop tools and applications by producing clean, efficient code
Automate tasks through appropriate tools and scripting
Review and debug code
Perform validation and verification testing
Collaborate with internal teams and vendors to fix and improve products
Document development phases and monitor systems
Ensure software is up-to-date with the latest technologies

Salary

40.000€ to 42.000€

jobs.title: Back End Developer (Madrid based)
jobs.description:
About you

Join us to re-imagine our new backend infrastructure to support our different clients: a new native app, the web app and the admin panel amongst others. You will be part of the definition and implementation of this challenging project from the ground up. You will work with the CTO to define software requirements and take the lead on operational and technical projects.

You will be able to work independently with little supervision. You should have excellent organisation and problem-solving skills, and have hands-on experience in software development and agile methodologies.

Your goal will be to develop high-quality software that is aligned with user needs and business goals.

Requirements

Proven experience creating APIs for native apps or web-based products
A strong understanding of technologies used in our tech stack:
 -  NodeJS
 - AWS infrastructure
 - API (REST or GraphQL) definition, implementation, documentation
 - SQL (PostgreSQL ideally)
 - Test-driven development
 - Deployment automation
Analytical mind with problem-solving aptitude
Ability to work independently
Excellent organisational and leadership skills
BSc/BA in Computer Science, a related degree or proven experience
Strong written and spoken English

Responsibilities

Develop high-quality software design and architecture
Identify, prioritise and execute tasks in the software development life cycle
Develop tools and applications by producing clean, efficient code
Automate tasks through appropriate tools and scripting
Review and debug code
Perform validation and verification testing
Collaborate with internal teams and vendors to fix and improve products
Document development phases and monitor systems
Ensure software is up-to-date with the latest technologies

Salary

40.000€ to 42.000€
